ch.ecma.csta.callcontrol

Interface CallControlServices


  • public interface CallControlServices
    A set of services that allow an application to control the state of calls.

    Prerequisites Before attempting to use CallControlServices, do the following:

    1. Acquire an instance of ServiceProvider by using the ServiceProvider.getServiceProvider method.
    2. Acquire an instance of CallControlServices by using the ServiceProvider.getService method.

    Note that not all of the requests and for these services may be supported. In these cases, the request description will state that it is not supported.
    Similarly, not all of the parameters may be supported for a given request, or for any associated events. In these cases, the description of the request (or event) will contain a table of the parameters that are supported.

    Also note that all supported CallControlServices requests are also available through AsynchronousServices.sendRequest. Consider using this service when you would like to not block your application while waiting for the response.


    General Information on ConnectionID and DeviceID Parameters

    When a request requires a ConnectionID parameter, it can be obtained from a previous response or event received in CallControlListener or by using snapshotDevice

    When a DeviceID is passed in the request, it can be either a third party device ID (representing an extension not controlled by this application) or a first party device ID (representing an extension controlled by this application). In either case, the DeviceID can be obtained from DeviceServices or from a previous response or event received in CallControlListener.

    Version:
    4.1
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

      • acceptCall

        AcceptCallResponse acceptCall(AcceptCall request)
                       throws CstaException
        Not supported.
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • alternateCall

        AlternateCallResponse alternateCall(AlternateCall request)
                             throws CstaException
        Place an existing active call on hold and retrieve a previously held call.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use AlternateCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         AlternateCall request = new AlternateCall();
 // heldCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.held(HeldEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setHeldCall(heldCallConnID);
 // activeCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event. 
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setActiveCall(activeCallConnID);
 AlternateCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.alternateCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - An AlternateCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the active call and a ConnectionID for the held call.
        Returns:
        An AlternateCallResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the specified DeviceID for the held call or active call is not valid.
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the specified ConnectionID is not valid. The call may have ended.
        InvalidConnectionIDForActiveCallException - Thrown if the controlling DeviceID in the active call and held call is different.
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if the heldcall is not in the alerting, connected, held, or bridged state.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if the activeCall to be put on hold is not currently active (in alerting state, for example) so it cannot be put on hold.
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - Thrown if the client attempted to add a seventh party (otherCall) to a call with six active parties.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user at the heldCall station is busy on a call or there is no idle appearance available. It is also possible that the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        StateIncompatibilityException - Thrown if the heldCall station user did not go off-hook within five seconds and is not capable of being forced off-hook.
        OutstandingReqLimitExceededException - Thrown if the client attempted to put a third party (activeCall) on hold (two parties are on hold already) on an analog station.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • answerCall

        AnswerCallResponse answerCall(AnswerCall request)
                       throws CstaException
        Connects an alerting or queued call.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use AnswerCall. Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         AnswerCall request = new AnswerCall();
 // connIDToAnswer is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.delivered(DeliveredEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setCallToBeAnswered(connIDToAnswer);
 AnswerCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.answerCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - An AnswerCall request that contains a ConnectionID that corresponds to the alerting call to be answered.
        Returns:
        An AnswerCallResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidCalledDeviceStateException - Thrown if the station user did not go off-hook within five seconds and is not capable of being forced off-hook.
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - Thrown if the client attempted to add a seventh party to a call with six active participants.
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if an invalid connection ID specified.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid device ID is specified in callToBeAnswered
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if the specified connection is not in a valid state for this operation.
        NoCallToAnswerException - Thrown if the call has been redirected to coverage.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user is busy or there is no idle appearance available.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • clearCall

        ClearCallResponse clearCall(ClearCall request)
                     throws CstaException
        Releases all devices from an existing call. In the case of a conference call, this results in all devices in the conference call being released from the call.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use ClearCall. Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         ClearCall request = new ClearCall(); 
 // connIDToClear is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 ClearCall request = new ClearCall();
 request.setCallToBeCleared(connIDToClear);
 callControlSvcs.clearCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A ClearCall request that contains a ConnectionID that corresponds to the call to be cleared.
        Returns:
        A ClearCallResponse
        Throws:
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if the ConnectionID specified in the request is not valid.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • clearConnection

        ClearConnectionResponse clearConnection(ClearConnection request)
                                 throws CstaException
        Releases a specific device from a call.

        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified ClearConnectionPrivateData object.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use ClearConnection.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         ClearConnection request = new ClearConnection();
 // connToClear is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setConnectionToBeCleared(connToClear);
 
 // add optional private data parameters to request
 ClearConnectionPrivateData privData = new ClearConnectionPrivateData();   
      
 // drop the call classifier resource from the call
 // DropResource.DR_TONE_GENERATOR is the other supported resource
 privData.setDropResource(DropResource.DR_CALL_CLASSIFIER);
 
 // specify user data that is passed to the application 
 // in the ConnectionClearedEvent event
 UserData userdata = new UserData();
 String uData = "specific user data here";
 userdata.setString(uData.getBytes());
 request.setUserData(userdata);
       
 CSTACommonArguments commArgs = new CSTACommonArguments();
 commArgs.setSinglePrivateData(privData);
 request.setExtensions(commArgs);
 
 ClearConnectionResponse response = callControlSvcs.clearConnection(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A ClearConnection request that contains a ConnectionID that corresponds to the connection to be cleared.
        Returns:
        A ClearConnectionResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if the specified connection is not in a valid state for this operation.
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if invalid connection ID specified. CallID may be invalid.
        NoConnectionToClearException - Thrown if the connection ID contained in the request is invalid. CallID may be incorrect.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • conferenceCall

        ConferenceCallResponse conferenceCall(ConferenceCall request)
                               throws CstaException
        Provides a conference of an existing held call and another active call at a conferencing device.

        This request is often used in conjunction with consultationCall.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use ConferenceCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         ConferenceCall request = new ConferenceCall();
 // activeCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setActiveCall(activeCallConnID);
 // heldCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.held(HeldEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setHeldCall(heldCallConnID));
 ConferenceCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.conferenceCall(request);
 // get the new connection ID
 ConnectionID newConferenceConnID = response.getConferenceCall();
 // print the call ids and devices on the conference
 ConnectionList connList = response.getConnections();
 for (ConnectionListItem connItem:connList.getConnectionListItem()) {
      LocalDeviceID deviceId = connItem.getNewConnection().getDeviceID();    
      System.out.println("Conference callId: " + connItem.getNewConnection().getCallID() +
          " DeviceId: " + deviceId.getContent());
 }
 
 // get the private data from the response
 if (response.getExtensions() != null {
     if (response.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData() instanceof ConferenceCallCallResponsePrivateData) {
         // get the call linkage data list (i.e. universal call id)
         ConferenceCallCallResponsePrivateData privDataObject = response.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
         privDataObject.getCallLinkageData();
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        request - A ConferenceCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the active call and a ConnectionID for the held call.
        Returns:
        A ConferenceCallResponse
        Optional data is available in the Avaya-specified ConferenceCallResponsePrivateData object.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the specified DeviceID is not valid. The device must be registered for the call to succeed.
        InvalidConnectionIDForActiveCallException - Thrown if the callID or deviceID in activeCall or heldCall has not been specified correctly.
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if the connections specified in the request are not in the valid states for the operation to take place. For example, it does not have one call active and one call in the held state as required.
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the specified ConnectionID is not valid. The call may have ended.
        ConferenceMemberLimitExceededException - Thrown if the request would have increased the number of parties on the call beyond the maximum number of conference parties as allowed by CM.
        ParameterTypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if DynamicID is specified in heldCall or activeCall.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • consultationCall

        ConsultationCallResponse consultationCall(ConsultationCall request)
                                   throws CstaException
        Put the existing active call at a device on hold and initiate a new call from the same device.

        This request is often used in conjunction with conferenceCall or transferCall.
        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified ConsultationCallPrivateData object. This private data object provides the ability to place DirectAgent Call or a SupervisorAssist Call.

        A DirectAgent call originates a call between a user station and an ACD agent logged into a split.

        A SupervisorAssist call originates a call between an ACD Agent's extension and another station extension (typically a supervisor). Priority calling is not supported for SupervisorAssist call.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use ConsultationCall. to make a ConsultationCall, to make a DirectAgent Call and to make a SupervisorAssist Call.

        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         ConsultationCall request = new ConsultationCall();
 // existingConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setExistingCall(existingConnID);
 // deviceIDForNewCall is a is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 request.setConsultedDevice(deviceIDForNewCall);
 ConsultationCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.consultationCall(request);
 // get the connection ID for the new call
 ConnectionID consultedConnID = response.getInitiatedCall();
 
 // set the optional userData and callCharacteristics parameters
 UserData userData = new UserData();
 userData.setString("creditCardNumber".getBytes());
 request.setUserData(userData);
 CallCharacteristics callChars = new CallCharacteristics();
 callChars.setHighPriorityCall(true);
 request.setCallCharacteristics(callChars);
 
 ConsultationCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.consultationCall(request);
 // get the connection ID for the new call
 ConnectionID connID = response.getCallingDevice();
 
 // get the optional callLinkageData from the response
 if (response.getExtensions() != null) {
 ConsultationCallResponsePrivateData privResponse = 
     (ConsultationCallResponsePrivateData) response.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
 String universalCallId = privResponse.getCallLinkageData()
     .getGlobalCallData().getGlobalCallLinkageID().getGloballyUniqueCallLinkageID());
 }
  
 // Send a DirectAgent Call request
 request = new ConsultationCall();
 CallPrivateData callPrivData = new CallPrivateData();
 callPrivData.setTypeOfCall(TypeOfCall.DIRECTAGENT);
  
 // acdGroup is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 callPrivData.setAcdGroup(acdGroup);
 ConsultationCallPrivateData privData = new ConsultationCallPrivateData();
 privData.setCallPrivateData(callPrivData);
 CSTACommonArguments commArgs = new CSTACommonArguments();
 commArgs.setSinglePrivateData(privData);
 request.setExtensions(commArgs);
 response = callControlSvcs.consultationCall(request);
  
 // Send a SupervisorAssist Call request
 // priority calling is not supported for supervisorAssist
 request = new ConsultationCall();
 CallPrivateData callPrivData = new CallPrivateData();
 callPrivData.setTypeOfCall(TypeOfCall.SUPERVISORASSIST);
  
 // acdGroup is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 callPrivData.setAcdGroup(acdGroup);
 privData = new ConsultationCallPrivateData();
 privData.setCallPrivateData(callPrivData);
 commArgs = new CSTACommonArguments();
 commArgs.setSinglePrivateData(privData);
 request.setExtensions(commArgs);
 response = callControlSvcs.consultationCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A ConsultationCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the existing call and a DeviceID for the device to be consulted.
        Returns:
        A ConsultationCallResponse
        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified ConsultationCallResponsePrivateData
        Throws:
        InvalidCallingDeviceStateException - Thrown if The originator does not go off-hook within five seconds after originating the call and cannot be forced off-hook
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if an invalid Connection ID was specified.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid Device ID was specified for existing call.
        ParameterTypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if DynamicID is specified for existing call.
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if the party to be put on hold is not currently active.
        OutstandingReqLimitExceededException - Thrown if the client attempted to put a third party (two parties are on hold already) on hold on an analog station.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        ValueOutOfRangeException - Thrown if the acdGroup contains an invalid value.
        PrivilegeViolationCalledDeviceException - Thrown if the COR check for completing the call failed. The call was attempted over a trunk that the originator has restricted from use.
        InvalidDestinationException - Thrown if the call was answered by an answering machine.
        InvalidObjectTypeException - Thrown if there is incompatible bearer service for the originating or destination address. For example. The originator is administered as a data hotline station or the destination is a data station. Call options are incompatible with this service.
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if request is incompatible with call state.
        SubscribedResourceAvailabilityException - Thrown if the service or option not subscribed or provisioned.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • deflectCall

        DeflectCallResponse deflectCall(DeflectCall request)
                         throws CstaException
        Diverts a call to another destination.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use DeflectCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         DeflectCall request = new DeflectCall();
 // connIDToDivert is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.delivered(DeliveredEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setCallToBeDiverted(connIDToDivert);
 // deviceIDForNewDest is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 request.setNewDestination(deviceIDForNewDest);
 DeflectCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.deflectCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A DeflectCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the call to divert and a DeviceID for the new destination.
        Returns:
        A DeflectCallResponse
        Throws:
        OperationException - Thrown if the service was requested on a queued call or some other protocol error occurred.
        InvalidObjectStateException - Thrown if one of the following:
        • if an invalid callID or device identifier is specified in deflectCall.
        • if the deflectCall is not in alerting state.
        • if attempted to redirect the call while in vector processing.
        PrivilegeViolationSpecifiedDeviceException - Thrown if one of the following:
        • if an invalid destination specified.
        • if toll restrictions on destination
        • COR restrictions on destination
        • if destination is remote access extension
        • if call origination restriction on the redirecting device
        • if call is in vector processing
        PrivilegeViolationCalledDeviceException - Thrown if one of the following:
        • Attempted to redirect a call back to the call originator or to the redirecting device itself.
        • Attempted to redirect a call on the calledDevice of a cstaMakePredictiveCall.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if call redirected to a busy station, a station that has call forwarding active, or a TEG group with one or more members busy will be rejected with this error.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • dialDigits

        DialDigitsResponse dialDigits(DialDigits request)
                       throws CstaException
        Not supported.
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • directedPickupCall

        DirectedPickupCallResponse directedPickupCall(DirectedPickupCall request)
                                       throws CstaException
        The Directed Pickup Call service moves a specified call and connects it at a new specified destination. This results in the connection being diverted to a new destination inside the switching sub-domain.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use DirectedPickupCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         DirectedPickupCall request = DirectedPickupCall DeflectCall();
 // connID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.delivered(DeliveredEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setCallToBePickedUp(connID);
 // deviceIDForNewDest is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 request.setRequestingDevice(deviceIDForNewDest);
 DirectedPickupCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.directedPickupCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A DirectedPickupCallCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the call to pick up and a DeviceID for the device that is picking up the call.
        Returns:
        A DirectedPickupCallResponse
        Throws:
        OperationException - Thrown if the service was requested on a queued call or some other protocol error occurred.
        InvalidObjectStateException - Thrown if one of the following:
        • if an invalid callID or device identifier is specified in deflectCall.
        • if the callToBePickedUp is not in alerting state.
        • if attempted to redirect the call while in vector processing.
        PrivilegeViolationSpecifiedDeviceException - Thrown if one of the following:
        • if an invalid destination specified.
        • if toll restrictions on destination
        • COR restrictions on destination
        • if destination is remote access extension
        • if call origination restriction on the redirecting device
        • if call is in vector processing
        PrivilegeViolationCalledDeviceException - Thrown if one of the following:
        • Attempted to redirect a call back to the call originator or to the redirecting device itself.
        • Attempted to redirect a call on the calledDevice of a cstaMakePredictiveCall.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if call redirected to a busy station, a station that has call forwarding active, or a TEG group with one or more members busy will be rejected with this error.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • generateDigits

        GenerateDigitsResponse generateDigits(GenerateDigits request)
                               throws CstaException
        Send a series of digits on behalf of a connection in a call.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use GenerateDigits.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         GenerateDigits request = new GenerateDigits();
 // connId is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setConnectionToSendDigits(connId);
 // allowed DTMF tones are 0-9, * and #
 String digitsToSend = "12345";
 request.setCharactersToSend(digitsToSend);
 // set optional tone duration parameter 
 // which specifies the duration, in ms, of each tone provided
 // supported values are 60-350
 long toneDuration = 100;
 request.setToneDuration(toneDuration);
 // set optional pause duration parameter 
 // which specifies the silences between digits (interdigit delay)
 // supported values are 40-100
 long pauseDuration = 50;
 request.setPauseDuration(pauseDuration);
 GenerateDigitsResponse response = callControlSvcs.generateDigits(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A GenerateDigits request that contains a ConnectionID that corresponds to the call on which the DTMF tones will be sent.
        Returns:
        A GenerateDigitsResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if invalid device ID specified in connectionToSendDigits.
        InvalidObjectStateException - Thrown if the service is requested on a call that is currently receiving switch-provided tone, such as dial tone, busy tone, ringback tone, intercept tone, Music-on-Hold/Delay, etc. The call must be in an established state in order to send DTMF tones.
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if invalid CallID specified in connectionToSendDigits.
        ObjectNotKnownException - Thrown if mandatory parameter is missing.
        ValueOutOfRangeException - Thrown if charactersToSend parameter has length equal to 0 or greater than 32 or invalid characters are specified in tones. The parameter value for toneDuration was out of the valid range of 60-350ms or the value for pauseDuration was out of the valid range of 40-100ms.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • groupPickupCall

        GroupPickupCallResponse groupPickupCall(GroupPickupCall request)
                                 throws CstaException
        Not supported.
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • holdCall

        HoldCallResponse holdCall(HoldCall request)
                   throws CstaException
        Place a connected connection on hold at the same device.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use HoldCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         HoldCall request = new HoldCall();
 // connID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setCallToBeHeld(connID);
 HoldCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.holdCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A HoldCall request that contains a ConnectionID specifying the active connection to be held.
        Returns:
        A HoldCallResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the connection identifier contained in the request is invalid or does not correspond to a station.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if invalid device ID specified in callToBeHeld.
        ParameterTypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if activeCall contains a DynamicID.
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if the party to be put on hold is not currently active.
        OutstandingReqLimitExceededException - Thrown if the client attempted to put a third party on hold (two parties are on hold already) on an analog station.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • intrudeCall

                         throws CstaException

        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • joinCall

                   throws CstaException
        Not supported.
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • makeCall

        MakeCallResponse makeCall(MakeCall request)
                   throws CstaException
        Set up a call between a calling device and a called device.
        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified MakeCallPrivateData object. This private data object provides the ability to place a DirectAgent Call or a SupervisorAssist Call.

        A DirectAgent call originates a call between a user station and an ACD agent logged into a split.

        A SupervisorAssist call originates a call between an ACD Agent's extension and another station extension (typically a supervisor).

        Example: The following code gives an examples of how to use MakeCall to make a call, to make a DirectAgent Call and to make a SupervisorAssist Call.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         MakeCall request = new MakeCall();
 // callingDeviceID and calledDeviceID are DeviceIDs that were retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 request.setCallingDevice(callingDeviceID);
 request.setCalledDirectoryNumber(calledDeviceID);
 // set the optional userData and callCharacteristics parameters
 UserData userData = new UserData();
 userData.setString("creditCardNumber".getBytes());
 request.setUserData(userData);
 CallCharacteristics callChars = new CallCharacteristics();
 callChars.setHighPriorityCall(true);
 request.setCallCharacteristics(callChars);
 
 MakeCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.makeCall(request);
 // get the connection ID for the new call
 ConnectionID connID = response.getCallingDevice();
 
 // get the optional callLinkageData from the response
 if (response.getExtensions() != null) {
 MakeCallResponsePrivateData privResponse = 
     (MakeCallResponsePrivateData) response.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
 String universalCallId = privResponse.getCallLinkageData()
     .getGlobalCallData().getGlobalCallLinkageID().getGloballyUniqueCallLinkageID());
 }
  
 // Send a DirectAgent Call request
 request = new MakeCall();
 CallPrivateData callPrivData = new CallPrivateData();
 callPrivData.setTypeOfCall(TypeOfCall.DIRECTAGENT);
  
 // acdGroup is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 callPrivData.setAcdGroup(acdGroup);
 MakeCallPrivateData privData = new MakeCallPrivateData();
 privData.setCallPrivateData(callPrivData);
 CSTACommonArguments commArgs = new CSTACommonArguments();
 commArgs.setSinglePrivateData(privData);
 request.setExtensions(commArgs);
 response = callControlSvcs.makeCall(request);
  
 // Send a SupervisorAssist Call request
 request = new MakeCall();
 CallPrivateData callPrivData = new CallPrivateData();
 callPrivData.setTypeOfCall(TypeOfCall.SUPERVISORASSIST);
  
 // acdGroup is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 callPrivData.setAcdGroup(acdGroup);
 privData = new MakeCallPrivateData();
 privData.setCallPrivateData(callPrivData);
 commArgs = new CSTACommonArguments();
 commArgs.setSinglePrivateData(privData);
 request.setExtensions(commArgs);
 response = callControlSvcs.makeCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A MakeCall request that contains a DeviceID for the called device and a DeviceID for calling device.
        Returns:
        A MakeCallResponse
        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified MakeCallResponsePrivateData
        Throws:
        InvalidCallingDeviceStateException - Thrown if the originator does not go off-hook within five seconds after originating the call and cannot be forced off-hook.
        CallingDeviceOutOfServiceException - Thrown if the callingDevice is out of service or not administered correctly in the switch.
        InvalidCallingDeviceIDException - Thrown if the Device ID or extension specified for the calling device is invalid.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user is busy on another call and cannot originate this call.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the calling device.
        ValueOutOfRangeException - Thrown if the acdGroup contains an invalid value.
        PrivilegeViolationCalledDeviceException - Thrown if the COR check for completing the call failed. The call was attempted over a trunk that the originator has restricted from use.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the acdGroup does not contain a valid hunt group extension. The callingDevice or calledDevice is an invalid station extension.
        InvalidDestinationException - Thrown if the call was answered by an answering machine.
        InvalidObjectTypeException - Thrown if there is incompatible bearer service for the originating or destination address. For example. The originator is administered as a data hotline station or the destination is a data station. Call options are incompatible with this service.
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if request is incompatible with call state.
        SubscribedResourceAvailabilityException - Thrown if the service or option not subscribed or provisioned.
        OperationException - Thrown if the data specified in the userData parameter exceeds the maximum allowable size of 96 bytes. Or the agent is not a member of the acdGroup or the agent is not currently logged into the acdGroup.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • makePredictiveCall

        MakePredictiveCallResponse makePredictiveCall(MakePredictiveCall request)
                                       throws CstaException
        Supported in AES 6.1 and later.

        Originates a call between two devices by first creating a connection to the called device. The service returns a positive acknowledgement that provides the connection at the called device.
        The DestinationDetection parameter supports the following combinations of values:
        DestinationDetection humanVoice
        DestinationAction remainConnected

        DestinationDetection answeringMachine
        DestinationAction remainConnected

        DestinationDetection answeringMachine
        DestinationAction clearCalledConnection

        Note: When DestinationAction for answerMachine is not specified, the default switch configured treatment for answering machines is applied.
        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified MakePredictiveCallPrivateData object.

        Example: The following code gives an examples of how to use MakePredictiveCall to make a call
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 
         MakePredictiveCall request = new MakePredictiveCall();
 // callingDeviceID and calledDeviceID are DeviceIDs that were retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 request.setCallingDevice(callingDeviceID);
 request.setCalledDirectoryNumber(calledDeviceID);
 // set the optional userData and callCharacteristics parameters
 UserData userData = new UserData();
 userData.setString("creditCardNumber".getBytes());
 request.setUserData(userData);
 CallCharacteristics callChars = new CallCharacteristics();
 callChars.setHighPriorityCall(true);
 request.setCallCharacteristics(callChars);
 // signallingDetection
 SignallingDetection signalDetect = new SignallingDetection();
 signalDetect.setSignallingCondition(SignallingCondition.CALLESTABLISHED);
 signalDetect.setSignallingConditionsAction(SignallingConditionsAction.DESTINATIONDETECTION);
 request.setSignallingDetection(signalDetect);
   
 // destinationDetection
 DestinationDetection destDetect = new DestinationDetection();
 DetectionItem detectItem = new DetectionItem();
 detectItem.setDestinationCondition(DestinationCondition.ANSWERINGMACHINE);
 detectItem.setDetectionAction(DetectionAction.REMAINCONNECTED);
 destDetect.addDetectionItem(detectItem);
 request.setDestinationDetection(destDetect);
 
 // alertTime
 // value must be 12-90 seconds
 request.setAlertTime((long)30);
 MakePredictiveCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.makePredictiveCall(request);
 // get the connection ID for the new call
 ConnectionID connID = response.getInitiatedCall();
 
 // get the optional callLinkageData from the response
 if (response.getExtensions() != null) {
 MakePredictiveCallResponsePrivateData privResponse = 
     (MakePredictiveCallResponsePrivateData) response.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
 String universalCallId = privResponse.getCallLinkageData()
     .getGlobalCallData().getGlobalCallLinkageID().getGloballyUniqueCallLinkageID());
 }
        Parameters:
        request - A MakePredictiveCall request that contains a DeviceID for the called device and a DeviceID for calling device.
        Returns:
        A MakePredictiveCallResponse
        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified MakePredictiveCallResponsePrivateData
        Throws:
        InvalidCallingDeviceIDException - Thrown if the Device ID or extension specified for the calling device is invalid.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the calling device.
        ValueOutOfRangeException - Thrown if the acdGroup contains an invalid value.
        PrivilegeViolationCalledDeviceException - Thrown if the COR check for completing the call failed. The call was attempted over a trunk that the originator has restricted from use.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the callingDevice or calledDevice is an invalid station extension.
        InvalidObjectTypeException - Thrown if there is incompatible bearer service for the originating or destination address. For example. The originator is administered as a data hotline station or the destination is a data station. Call options are incompatible with this service.
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if request is incompatible with call state.
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - Thrown if there aren't any Call Classifiers, time slot or trunks available or the queue is full.
        SubscribedResourceAvailabilityException - Thrown if the service or option not subscribed or provisioned.
        OperationException - Thrown if the data specified in the userData parameter exceeds the maximum allowable size of 96 bytes. Or the agent is not a member of the acdGroup or the agent is not currently logged into the acdGroup.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • parkCall

        ParkCallResponse parkCall(ParkCall request)
                   throws CstaException
        Not supported.
        Throws:
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • reconnectCall

        ReconnectCallResponse reconnectCall(ReconnectCall request)
                             throws CstaException
        Clear a specified connection at the reconnecting device and retrieve a specified held connection at the same device.

        Optional parameters are supported in the private data area with an Avaya-specified ReconnectCallPrivateData object.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use ReconnectCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         ReconnectCall request = new ReconnectCall();
 // heldCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.held(HeldEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setHeldCall(heldCallConnID);
 // activeCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event. 
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setActiveCall(activeCallConnID);
 
 // add optional private data parameters to request
 ReconnectCallPrivateData privData = new ReconnectCallPrivateData();   
      
 // drop the call classifier resource from the call
 // DropResource.DR_TONE_GENERATOR is the other supported resource
 privData.setDropResource(DropResource.DR_CALL_CLASSIFIER);
 
 // specify user data that is passed to the application 
 // in the ConnectionClearedEvent event
 UserData userdata = new UserData();
 String uData = "specific user data here";
 userdata.setString(uData.getBytes());
 privData.setUserData(userdata);
       
 CSTACommonArguments commArgs = new CSTACommonArguments();
 commArgs.setSinglePrivateData(privData);
 request.setExtensions(commArgs);
 
 ReconnectCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.reconnectCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A ReconnectCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the active call and a ConnectionID for the held call.
        Returns:
        A ReconnectCallResponse
        Throws:
        StateIncompatibilityException - Thrown if the heldCall station user did not go off-hook within five seconds and is not capable of being forced off-hook.
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - Thrown if one of the following:
        • The switch is busy with another CSTA request. This can happen when two TSAPI Services are issuing requests (for example, Clear Connection, etc.) to the same device.
        • The client attempted to add a seventh call to a call with six active parties.
        InvalidConnectionIDForActiveCallException - Thrown if the controlling deviceID in activeCall and heldCall is different
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if invalid connection ID specified in heldCall.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if invalid device ID specified in heldCall or activeCall.
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if the specified activeCall at the station is not currently active (in alerting or held state) so it cannot be dropped. The Reconnect Call Service operation stops and the heldCall will not be retrieved. The specified heldCall at the station is not in the alerting, connected, held, or bridged state.
        ParameterTypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if DynamicID is specified in heldCall.
        NoCallToAnswerException - Thrown if the call was redirected to coverage within the five-second interval.
        StateIncompatibilityException - Thrown if the heldCall station user did not go off-hook within five seconds and is not capable of being forced off-hook.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the user is busy on a call or there are no idle appearances available.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • retrieveCall

        RetrieveCallResponse retrieveCall(RetrieveCall request)
                           throws CstaException
        Connects a specified held connection.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use RetrieveCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         RetrieveCall request = new RetrieveCall();
 // heldCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.held(HeldEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.callToBeRetrieved(heldCallConnID);
 RetrieveCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.retrieveCall(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A RetrieveCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the held call to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A RetrieveCallResponse
        Throws:
        ConferenceMemberLimitExceededException - Thrown if the maximum number of parties are on the conference.
        StateIncompatibilityException - Thrown if the user was on-hook when the request was made and he/she did not go off-hook within five seconds (call remains on hold)
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the connection identifier contained in the request is invalid or does not correspond to a station.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if invalid device ID specified in callToBeRetrieved.
        ParameterTypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if callToBeRetrieved contains a DynamicID.
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if the specified call at the station is cleared so it can not be retrieved.
        NoHeldCallException - Thrown if the specified call at the station is not in the held state so it can not be retrieved.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • selectiveListeningHold

        SelectiveListeningHoldResponse selectiveListeningHold(SelectiveListeningHold request)
                                               throws CstaException
        Supported in AES 6.1 and later.

        The Selective Listening Hold Service allows a client application to prevent a specific party on a call from hearing anything said by another specific party or all other parties on the call. It allows a client application to put a party's (subjectConnection) listening path to a selected party (selectedParty) on listen-hold, or all parties on an active call on listen-hold. The selected party or all parties may be stations or trunks. A party that has been listen-held may continue to talk and be heard by other connected parties on the call since this service does not affect the talking or listening path of any other party. A party will be able to hear parties on the call from which it has not been listen-held, but will not be able to hear any party from which it has been listen-held. This service will also allow the listen-held party to be retrieved (i.e., to again hear the other party or parties on the call).

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use SelectiveListeningHold.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         SelectiveListeningHold request = new SelectiveListeningHold();
 // connID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 
 // when allParties is false, selectedParty is required
 // when allParties is true, selectedParty is not required
 boolean allParties = false;
 SelectiveListening selectListen = new SelectiveListening();
 selectListen.setAllParties(allParties);
 selectListen.setSubjectConnection(subjectConnId);
 selectListen.setSelectedParty(selectedPartyConnId);
 SelectiveListeningHold request = new SelectiveListeningHold();
 request.setSelectiveListening(selectListen);
 
 SelectiveListeningHoldResponse response = callControlSvcs.selectiveListeningHold(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A SelectiveListeningHold request that contains a ConnectionID specifying the subject connection to be listen held.
        Returns:
        A SelectiveListeningHoldResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the connection identifier contained in the request is invalid or does not correspond to a station.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the party specified is not supported by this service (e.g., announcements, extensions without hardware, etc).
        ValueOutOfRangeException - Thrown if a party specified is not part of the call or in wrong state (e.g., a two-party call with the selectedParty still in the alerting state).
        InvalidObjectStateException - Thrown if the request to listen-hold from all parties is not granted because there are no other eligible parties on the call (including any that were previously listen-held).
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if the subject party is not currently active.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • selectiveListeningRetrieve

        SelectiveListeningRetrieveResponse selectiveListeningRetrieve(SelectiveListeningRetrieve request)
                                                       throws CstaException
        Supported in AES 6.1 and later.

        The Selective Listening Retrieve Service allows a client application to retrieve a party (subjectConnection) from listen-hold to another party (selectedParty) or all parties that were previously being listen-held.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use SelectiveListeningRetrieve.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         SelectiveListeningRetrieve request = new SelectiveListeningRetrieve();
 // connID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 
 // when allParties is false, selectedParty is required
 // when allParties is true, selectedParty is not required
 boolean allParties = false;
 SelectiveListening selectListen = new SelectiveListening();
 selectListen.setAllParties(allParties);
 selectListen.setSubjectConnection(subjectConnId);
 selectListen.setSelectedParty(selectedPartyConnId);
 SelectiveListeningRetrieve request = new SelectiveListeningRetrieve();
 request.setSelectiveListening(selectListen);
 
 SelectiveListeningRetrieveResponse response = callControlSvcs.selectiveListeningRetrieve(request);
        Parameters:
        request - A SelectiveListeningRetrieve request that contains a ConnectionID specifying the subject connection to be listen held.
        Returns:
        A SelectiveListeningRetrieveResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the connection identifier contained in the request is invalid or does not correspond to a station.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the party specified is not supported by this service (e.g., announcements, extensions without hardware, etc).
        ValueOutOfRangeException - Thrown if a party specified is not part of the call or in wrong state.
        NoActiveCallException - Thrown if the subject party is not currently active.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • singleStepConferenceCall

        SingleStepConferenceCallResponse singleStepConferenceCall(SingleStepConferenceCall request)
                                                   throws CstaException
        Adds a party to an existing call.

        Note that the party that is added is not alerted in any way: their telephone is forced off-hook. As a result, this operation should generally be used to add an application controlled device to the call, rather than to add actual parties to the conference.

        The extensions parameter returned in the SingleStepConferenceCallResponse contains additional data in the parameter's CSTACommonArguments private data area with an Avaya-specified SingleStepConferenceCallResponsePrivateData object.

        The data that is returned is:

        • globallyUniqueCallLinkageID - Always provided
        • connectionList - Always provided

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use SingleStepConferenceCall.
        This example shows the application requesting listen only (SILENT) mode. Note that processing the information contained in the response is purely optional. Simply receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         SingleStepConferenceCall confReq = new SingleStepConferenceCall();
 // currentConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 confReq.setActiveCall(currentConnID);
 
 // calledDevice is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 confReq.setDeviceToJoin(calledDevice);
 confReq.setParticipationType(ParticipationType.SILENT);
 SingleStepConferenceCallResponse confResp = service.singleStepConferenceCall(confReq);
 
 System.out.println("New ConnectionID is " + confResp.getConferencedCall().getCallID() +
        ":" + confResp.getConferencedCall().getDeviceID().getContent());

 SingleStepConferenceCallResponsePrivateData priv = 
         (SingleStepConferenceCallResponsePrivateData)
         confResp.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
 System.out.println("UCID is " + priv.getGloballyUniqueCallLinkageID());
 ConnectionListItem [] connListItems = priv.getConnectionList().getConnectionListItem();
 ConnectionID [] conns = priv.getConnectionList().getConnection();
 for (int i = 0; i < conns.length; i++) {
     System.out.println("Connection " + i + " is " + conns[i].getCallID() +
             ":" + conns[i].getDeviceID().getContent());
 }
        Parameters:
        request - A SingleStepConferenceCall request that indicates a ConnectionID and a DeviceID. The given device is added to the call represented by the given ConnectionID. Also allows application to specify listen only mode if desired so fewer resources are allocated on CM.
        Returns:
        A SingleStepConferenceCallResponse that contains the new ConnectionID for the party that was added, a Universal Call ID, and a list of other connections on the call.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if the specified DeviceID is not valid. The device must be registered for the call to succeed.
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the specified ConnectionID is not valid. The call may have ended.
        ConferenceMemberLimitExceededException - Thrown if the request would have increased the number of parties on the call beyond the maximum number of conference parties as allowed by CM.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the deviceToJoin is already active on a call. The deviceToJoin must be idle for the request to succeed.
        InvalidCallingDeviceStateException - Thrown if the deviceToJoin is not registered.
        InvalidDestinationDeviceStateException - Thrown if the deviceToJoin could not be forced off-hook (e.g. because it's an analog station) and it could not be forced off-hook within 5 seconds.
        InvalidParticipationTypeException - Thrown if the participation type of "NONE" is requested.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • singleStepTransferCall

        SingleStepTransferCallResponse singleStepTransferCall(SingleStepTransferCall request)
                                               throws CstaException
        Transfers an existing connection at a device to another device.

        The extensions parameter returned in the SingleStepTransferCallResponse contains additional data in the parameter's CSTACommonArguments private data area with an Avaya-specified SingleStepTransferCallResponsePrivateData object.

        The data that is returned is:

        • globallyUniqueCallLinkageID - Always provided

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use SingleStepTransferCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         SingleStepTransferCall request = new SingleStepTransferCall();
 // activeCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setActiveCall(activeCallConnID);
 // transferToDeviceID is a DeviceID that was retrieved  
 // using DeviceServices.getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId)
 request.setTransferredTo(transferToDeviceID);
 SingleStepTransferCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.singleStepTransferCall(request);
 ConnectionID transferedConnID = response.getTransferredCall();

 SingleStepTransferCallResponsePrivateData privData = 
         (SingleStepTransferCallResponsePrivateData)
         response.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
 System.out.println("UCID is " + privData.getCallLinkageData());
        Parameters:
        request - A SingleStepTransferCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the active call and a DeviceID for the new called (transferredTo) device.
        Returns:
        A SingleStepTransferCallResponse
        Throws:
        ConferenceMemberLimitExceededException - Thrown if the maximum number of parties are on the conference.
        StateIncompatibilityException - Thrown if both calls are alerting. Both calls are being service-observed. An active call is in a vector-processing stage.
        InvalidConnectionIDForActiveCallException - Thrown if the callID in activeCall has not been specified correctly.
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the controlling deviceID in activeCall or transferredTo has not been specified correctly.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid device ID is specified in activeCall
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if the connections specified in the request are not in the valid states for the operation to take place. For example, it does not have one active call as required.
        ParameterTypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if DynamicID is specified for activeCall.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • transferCall

        TransferCallResponse transferCall(TransferCall request)
                           throws CstaException
        Transfers a call held at a device to an active call at the same device.

        This request is often used in conjunction with consultationCall.

        Example: The following code gives an example of how to use TransferCall.
        Receiving the response is an indication that the request succeeded. 

         TransferCall request = new TransferCall();
 // activeCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.established(EstablishedEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setActiveCall(activeCallConnID);
 // heldCallConnID is a ConnectionID that was discovered from a previous response or event.
 // Two common sources are CallControlListener.held(HeldEvent)
 // or SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(SnapshotDevice)
 request.setHeldCall(heldCallConnID);
 TransferCallResponse response = callControlSvcs.transferCall(request);
 ConnectionID transferedConnID = response.getTransferredCall();
 // print the call ids and devices
 ConnectionList connList = response.getConnections();
 for (ConnectionListItem connItem:connList.getConnectionListItem()) {
      LocalDeviceID deviceId = connItem.getNewConnection().getDeviceID();    
      System.out.println("Transfer callId: " + connItem.getNewConnection().getCallID() +
          " DeviceId: " + deviceId.getContent());
 }
 
 // get the private data from the response
 if (response.getExtensions() != null {
     if (privDataObject instanceof TransferCallResponsePrivateData) {
         // get the call linkage data list (i.e. universal call id)
         TransferCallResponsePrivateData privDataObject = (TransferCallResponsePrivateData)event.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
         privDataObject.getCallLinkageDataList().getNewCallLinkageData();
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        request - A TransferCall request that contains a ConnectionID for the active call and a ConnectionID for the held call.
        Returns:
        A TransferCallResponse
        Optional data is available in the Avaya-specified TransferCallResponsePrivateData object.
        Throws:
        ConferenceMemberLimitExceededException - Thrown if the maximum number of parties are on the conference.
        StateIncompatibilityException - Thrown if both calls are alerting. Both calls are being service-observed. An active call is in a vector-processing stage.
        InvalidConnectionIDForActiveCallException - Thrown if the callID in activeCall or heldCall has not been specified correctly.
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if the controlling deviceID in activeCall or heldCall has not been specified correctly.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid device ID is specified in heldCall or activeCall
        InvalidConnectionStateException - Thrown if the connections specified in the request are not in the valid states for the operation to take place. For example, it does not have one active call and one held call as required.
        ParameterTypeNotSupportedException - Thrown if DynamicID is specified for activeCall or heldCall.
        ResourceBusyException - Thrown if the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
        SecurityViolationException - Thrown if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.
